content: CPF Savings Asked by AnonymousAsked on 03 Oct 2018Should I get the DBS Multipler account? Want to earn interest but my salary is so low.. After CPF, at most i get $1700. Wanted to apply DBS Multipler but I do not have credit card. Dilemma?4 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 03 Oct 2018Your best bet is CIMB Fastsaver at 1% no string attach.​Try this by Seedly see what it says : https://seedly.sg/tools/savings-account-calculator​​0 comments2

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hi, in your case, I would suggest CIMB FastSaver which gives you 1% interest so long as you maintain at least $1,000 inside with no other requirements such as salary credit or minimum spending like DBS Multiplier in order to earn the extra interest. Moreover, you can easily transfer funds out instantly and for free via FAST into your DBS account for spending (withdraw/card transactions)2 comments1

Question Poster03 Oct 2018Never heard of FAST before? How does it works? Is CIMB safe?Gabriel Lee04 Oct 2018FAST refers to Fast And Secure Transfers, same as what DBS/POSB & other banks have. Yes CIMB is safe, it's SDIC insured for up to $50k like all other banks
Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Oct 2018I think the CIMB Fastsaver would be a better option for you :)0 comments1

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Oct 2018https://blog.seedly.sg/best-savings-accounts-2018/Take a look at other savings accounts then. I think for you just get CIMB Fastsaver because your pay not that high.0 comments1
